intro: Lisianthius parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaf lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
